review.title: A Study of an Modeling Method of T-S fuzzy System Based on Moving Fuzzy Reasoning and Its Application
review.abstract: To improve the effectiveness of the fuzzy identification, a structure identification method based on moving rate is proposed for T-S fuzzy model. The proposed method is called "T-S modeling (or T-S fuzzy identification method) based on moving rate". First, to improve the shortcomings of existing fuzzy reasoning methods based on matching degree, the moving rates for s-type, z-type and trapezoidal membership functions of T-S fuzzy model were defined. Then, the differences between proposed moving rate and existing matching degree were explained. Next, the identification method based on moving rate is proposed for T-S model. Finally, the proposed identification method is applied to the fuzzy modeling for the precipitation forecast and security situation prediction. Test results show that the proposed method significantly improves the effectiveness of fuzzy identification.

sections.heading: 2.3. Comparison with existing method
sections.text: The agility rate defined in Equation (5), (6) and (7) is considered to be the center of the uncertainty element and not a geometric center, so that it accurately reflects the degree of membership function of input and uncertainty element. However, in [22, 23] the degree of membership function was defined as the level of the intersection point between entry and membership function, so that in the event of a change in membership function it does not accurately express the degree of membership function. Consider, for example, the situation in Figure 4. Relationship between the degree of membership function and the agility rate In Figure 4, membership functions A and B are different. sections.heading: 3.3. Identification of premise
sections.text: The main difficulty in fuzzy modeling is the identification of the premise. The identification step of premise q consists of the identification steps for the structure and the parameters. The identification of the structure consists of the selection of fuzzy variables for the premise and fuzzy partition for the variable space. Before looking at the identification for the premise structure, one first considers the parameter identification, where the premise parameters are the coordinates of the x-a1, a2, a3, a4, which characterize the belonging function (Figure 6). If the parameter values for all premise fuzzy variables are given, one gets the output y0 for the weight d i. Under this condition, the optimal structure and the sequence parameters are identified. To determine the premise parameters, the search for the minimum parameter value is necessary. To avoid the complexity of the calculation, there is no need to select the sequence structure.

The reason for this is that the proposed method is an argumentation method in which different argumentation results are obtained from different membership functions and input information [35, 36, 37].

sections.heading: 6. Conclusion
sections.text: In this paper, the limitation of the identification method based on the existing matching grade i is considered, the moving rate of the s-type, z-type and trapezoidal membership functions is proposed, and the fuzzy modeling method based on it is proposed. Then, the identification method Metho d, the movable rate is proposed, using a simple algorithm and an SVD method to solve no n-differential operation and the ranking problem. Subsequently, the proposed method is applied to a nonlinear system and a blurred modeling of the prediction of precipitation forecasts and safety situations, proving that the model accuracy of the proposed method is better than existing meth-ods.Ackledgement This paper is supported and improved by the National Natural Science Foundation of China (No. 6097015), the Doktor Start Foundation of Liaoning Province (No. 2081019). This paper is based on the 1988 "Structure of Identification and Fuzzy."
